title.narrative: Training in cooperation with Dutch MFA (Embassy)_1

description.narrative: 1) Enhance the quality and competences of the lead negotiation teams of conflict groups; 2) Support a track I peace initiative.

Training mission of two days in negotiation skills for representatives of a conflict group who committed themselves to engage in a track I negotiation process. The training was set up in cooperation with the Netherlands embassy.

title.narrative: Output 3: Sustainable cooperation with partner organisations has been established or intensified

1. Established cooperation with new partner organizations 2. Partner organizations send requests for follow up training activities 3. Increased interest of external organizations and stakeholders to collaborate with Clingendael (descriptive indicator), for example through training modules and training design

comment.narrative: A baseline has not been established. These are descriptive rather than quantitative indicators.

title.narrative: Output 2: Relevant participation in trainings has increased
1. At least 30% of participants is female 2. At least 70% of female participants feels more confident in their ability to participate in in a negotiation/mediation process

comment.narrative: Indicator 1: will be established over 2017 Indicator 2: will be established over 2017
Indicator 1: 20% of the participants was female. Indicator 2: no data on this

title.narrative: Output 1: Trainings are provided to relevant persons

1. At least 80% of participants is already active in negotiations and/or mediation, or wants to become more active in this field; 2. At least 75% of participants rated the training received as useful in their current or anticipated work; 3. At least 75% of participants rated the training received with at least a 4 on a scale of 1 to 5. 4. At least 60% feels very confident in their ability to participate in a negotiation/mediation process or to support others during negotiation/mediation; 5. At least 75% of participants expects to implement gained knowledge and skills in their work.

comment.narrative: We do not have a baseline for these indicator yet, this will be established based on the paricipation and feedback over 2017.

According to feedback from the trainer, the following can be said regarding some of the indicators: Indicator 1: Participants originated from negotiation team, some in civilian capacity, some as commanders. All had practical experience, but low content/strategy/tools knowledge. Indicator 3: according to the trainer, the participants were very positive about the quality of the training. The training was only one-day however
